title: Millennium Coastal Path Llanelli Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Colin Bell / Pavilion Cafe at 8km on the Llanelli Millennium Coastal Park
images.caption: Pavilion Cafe at 8km on the Llanelli Millennium Coastal Park. The field is a sports ground, being used for a primary school sports day when I went past. Widespread cheating in the sack races...

images.title: Ron Strutt / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: The Millennium Coastal Path at Pembrey. This is part of National Cycle Network route 4 where it runs along the edge of the dunes at Pembrey at the western end of the Llanelli Millennium Coastal Park. The 22km long park was mostly reclaimed from industrial wasteland and otherwise useless waste products - 800,000 tons of pulverised fuel ash from the site of the Carmarthen Bay power station and sewage sludge and silt from Burry Port harbour - were used in the reclamation process.

images.title: Nick Earl / Visitor Centre
images.caption: Looking out over the Loughor Estuary. Showing the path along the Millennium Coastal Park, the railway, mudflats and (out of the square) the river and the western end of the Gower.

images.title: Colin Bell / Looking out over the Loughor Estuary
images.caption: Looking out over the Loughor Estuary from the path

images.title: Tbirdcymru / CC0
images.caption: A cyclist on the surfaced path

images.title: Nick Earl / Stainless Steel Pillar
images.caption: Stainless Steel Pillar next to the path

description: This fabulous country park in Carmarthenshire has miles of coastal cycling and walking paths to enjoy. You can follow National Cycle Route 4 along a super traffic free path which passes along the beautiful Loughor estuary and the Gower peninsula. The route takes you past Llanelli beach and Tywyn beach to Burry Port where you will find a pretty harbour, beach and the newest marina in Wales. You then head back east passing Sandy Water Park and Machynys beach before coming to the National Wetlands Centre where you can look out for a variety of birdlife. Look out for flocks of dunlin, ringed plover, sanderling and redshank along the coast whilst shelduck, oystercatcher and curlew can be seen further out on the mudflats. Other highlights in the park include the excellent Discovery Centre where you will find a wealth of information about the area in a fabulous modern building. If you would like to continue your outing you could head west along the coast to the fabulous Pembrey Country Park where you will find more lovely coastal scenery, woodland wildlife trails and bike hire from the Ski Pembrey centre.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The park includes the St Elli's Bay eatery located in an iconic building situated on Llanelli beach. You can enjoy your refreshments with a great view of the coast here. You can find the cafe at the Discovery Centre North Dock, Traeth Ffordd with a postcode of SA15 2LF for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The path and the adjacent beach are a great place to bring your dog for a bracing walk. The park cafe mentioned above has a dog friendly area within the ground floor bistro too.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking around Llanelli you could pick up the St Illtyd's Walk and follow it north up to the Swiss Valley Reservoirs. There's footpaths and a cycle path running along the two pretty reservoirs which are located near Swiss Valley. It's a peaceful spot with more lovely scenery to enjoy. Near here there's the town of Pontarddulais where you can start a walk up to the viewpoint on Graig Fawr. At the lake near Sandy you can pick up the Swiss Valley Cycle Route. The multi user trail runs along a disused railway path from the park to Tumble, passing the Swiss Valley Reservoir on the way. The Heart of Wales Line Trail starts/finishes at the park. The 143 mile trail explores the Heart of Wales Railway Line, a wonderful rural railway running between Swansea and Shrewsbury. The trail visit several train stations, old railway lines and photogenic railway viaducts. You can follow the trail east to visit Gorseinon and Pontarddulais.

display_address: Swiss Valley Trail, Seaside, Llanelli Rural, Llanelli, Sir Gaerfyrddin / Carmarthenshire, Cymru / Wales, SA15 4SG, United Kingdom
